etymology.description: pictogram: a container filled to the brim.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a vessel filled to capacity, evoking the idea of fullness and abundance. This visual sense later supported meanings in related graphs like 富 and 福 that center on wealth and blessing.

examples.chinese: 仓里粮囤已畐(倉裡糧囤已畐)。
examples.english: The grain bins in the granary are already full.

examples.chinese: 雨水丰沛(雨水豐沛)，水库渐畐(水庫漸畐)。
examples.english: With abundant rainfall, the reservoir is gradually full.

examples.chinese: 收成甚畐(收成甚畐)，家家喜庆(家家喜慶)。
examples.pinyin: Shōuchéng shèn fú, jiā jiā xǐqìng.
examples.english: The harvest is very abundant, and every household rejoices.
